column4: Hello! How do I check what specific  nvidia card I have? Google confuses me...
you should look for something like this: 01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation G92 [GeForce GTS 250] (rev a2)
Yeah, I have two lines that go like that, haha!
02:00.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation C77 [GeForce 8200] (rev a2) 03:00.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation G98 [GeForce G 100] (rev a1)
well thats strange, maybe you have an onboard card and a real card in the computer?
how would I check if that is so? I haven't added anything to this shitty computer... nvidia knows how to make life difficult though
look at the back of the computer, see how many VGA and/or DVI ports there are, and where they are located
well, there are two ports for connecting the screen, one at the top and one at the bottom
yeah, then you have two video cards
the reason I ask is because I am running virtualbox with a windows vista... and I can't get the right nvidia drivers done which I need... Any idea how I would go about getting it installed?
update manager hasn't done the trick so far...
so ubuntu is the virtual one?
Is there a way of telling which of the two cards my screen is currently connected to then?:)
